page.title: 02Elwick Village
page.content: Elwick is a small village just off the {A19}and four miles west of{Hartlepool. It has a large green with trees on it , most of which are one hundred years old. The trees were planted to commemorate Queen Victoria's Jubilee. The green has a Telephone Box,a drinking fountain built on top of an old blocked up well,a bus shelter and two or three public seats.The village is set in the countryside surrounded by farms and is connected,by a wooded ghyll,to{Dalton Piercy.}Part of the ghyll near the church has been flattened to make a playing field. We have a church, two public houses,a school,a W.I.Hall, an old school which is used as a Church Hall,and a shop which has a Post Office in it.
